intro: Phyllorkis meridensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in sunny, arid environments. It produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in early spring. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
